intro: Lithospermum purpureocoeruleum, commonly known as purple and blue rock pepper, is a member of the Boraginaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the southeastern United States, particularly in Georgia and Florida. The plant is characterized by its hairy, blue-green leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from purple to blue. Its roots contain compounds such as lithospermic acid, which have been studied for their potential medicinal properties. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or open woodland habitats.
